title: 23. The Megarian Decree, c. 432 BCE
description: The Megarian Decree and its role in escalating tensions between Athens and Sparta before the Peloponnesian War.

questions.question: In approximately which year was the Megarian Decree issued?
Who was responsible for issuing the Megarian Decree?
What did the Megarian Decree prohibit?
options: Megarians using Athenian ports and markets
Megarian participation in the Delian League

questions.question: Which Greek state was targeted by the decree?
What type of power did the decree most clearly demonstrate?
Did the decree technically break the Thirty Year Peace?
How does Thucydides initially treat the Megarian Decree in his narrative?
options: As the main cause of war

questions.question: What later claim does Thucydides make about the decree?
options: Revoking it might have avoided war

questions.question: According to Plutarch, what incident led to the decree?
options: Desecration of a temple in Athens
The killing of an Athenian envoy

questions.question: What offence did Plutarch say the Megarians committed?
Why does Plutarch suggest Pericles refused to revoke the decree?
Which individuals’ trials does Plutarch link to Pericles’ actions?
Which comic playwright mocked the causes of the war?
In Aristophanes’ Acharnians, what is humorously blamed for the war?
What role does Aspasia play in Aristophanes’ account?
What alternative motive for the decree is suggested by historians?
How might the decree have affected Megara if enforced long-term?
Which other state complained of mistreatment by Athens at this time?
What other conflict increased tensions with Corinth around this period?
What is the wider significance of the Megarian Decree?
options: It strengthened the Thirty Year Peace
It directly triggered the Peloponnesian War
